comment: If P is on the segment AB and AQ = BQ, then PA ` x. ` PB = BQ<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> ` - ` PQ<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML>. This follows from two uses of ~ chordthmlem3 to show that PQ<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> = QM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> ` + ` PM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> and BQ<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> = QM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> ` + ` BM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML>, so BQ<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> ` - ` PQ<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> = (QM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> ` + ` BM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML>) ` - ` (QM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> ` + ` PM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML>) = BM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML> ` - ` PM<HTML><sup>2</sup></HTML>, which equals PA ` x. ` PB by ~ chordthmlem4 . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)
